item.title: Alabama Man Pleads Guilty to Hacking SEC’s X Account
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Eric Council Jr. pleaded guilty to hacking the X (formerly Twitter) account of the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

The post Alabama Man Pleads Guilty to Hacking SEC’s X Account appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of February 10, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of February 10, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: US Cyber Agency Puts Election Security Staffers Who Worked With the States on Leave
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Staffers at the nation’s cybersecurity agency whose job is to ensure the security of US elections have been placed on administrative leave.

The post US Cyber Agency Puts Election Security Staffers Who Worked With the States on Leave appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: OpenAI Finds No Evidence of Breach After Hacker Offers to Sell 20 Million Credentials
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
A hacker recently offered to sell 20 million OpenAI credentials, but the data likely comes from information stealers, not the AI firm’s systems.

The post OpenAI Finds No Evidence of Breach After Hacker Offers to Sell 20 Million Credentials appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Apple Confirms USB Restricted Mode Exploited in ‘Extremely Sophisticated’ Attack
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Cupertino’s security response team said the flaw was used in “an extremely sophisticated attack against specific targeted individuals.” 

The post Apple Confirms USB Restricted Mode Exploited in ‘Extremely Sophisticated’ Attack  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Trump’s AI Ambition and China’s DeepSeek Overshadow an AI Summit in Paris
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
French organizers said “the summit aims at promoting an ambitious French and European AI strategy” as advances in the sector have been led by the U.S. and China.

The post Trump’s AI Ambition and China’s DeepSeek Overshadow an AI Summit in Paris appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Orthanc Server Vulnerability Poses Risk to Medical Data, Healthcare Operations
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
A critical vulnerability found in Orthanc servers can pose a serious risk to medical data and healthcare operations.

The post Orthanc Server Vulnerability Poses Risk to Medical Data, Healthcare Operations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Expands Copilot Bug Bounty Program, Increases Payouts
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Microsoft has added more Copilot consumer products to its bug bounty program and is offering higher rewards for medium-severity vulnerabilities.

The post Microsoft Expands Copilot Bug Bounty Program, Increases Payouts appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: HPE Says Personal Information Stolen in 2023 Russian Hack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
HPE is notifying an unknown number of individuals that Russian hackers accessed their personal information in a December 2023 attack.

The post HPE Says Personal Information Stolen in 2023 Russian Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Indiana Man Sentenced to 20 Years in Prison for Hacking, $37 Million Crypto Theft
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Evan Light was sentenced to 20 years in federal prison for hacking an investment holdings company and stealing $37 million in cryptocurrency.

The post Indiana Man Sentenced to 20 Years in Prison for Hacking, $37 Million Crypto Theft appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Information of 120,000 Stolen in Ransomware Attack on Georgia Hospital
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Memorial Hospital and Manor says 120,000 people had their personal information stolen in a November 2024 ransomware attack.

The post Information of 120,000 Stolen in Ransomware Attack on Georgia Hospital appeared first on SecurityWeek.
